definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: be clean, pure (Ar. t.ahara, t.ahura id.; NH id., Pi. make or declare ceremonially clean; Aram. [[טְהַר]] emptiness, [[טִיהֲרָא]] brightness; Sab. [[טהר]] Hal:682; Eth. 0at’hara: tat’4hara: purify, wash oneself with water)—
be clean, i.e. (miraculously) freed from leprosy by washing in the Jordan 2Ki 5:10, 2Ki 5:12, 2Ki 5:13, 2Ki 5:14.

be clean ceremonially (only H P), Le 15:13, Le 15:28, Le 15:28 (P), Le 22:4 (H); by washing with water, the flesh Le 22:7 (H); garments Le 13:6, Le 13:34, Le 13:58, Nu 31:24 (all P); both flesh and garments Le 17:5 (H), Le 14:8, Le 14:9, Le 15:13, Nu 19:19 (all P); other articles Le 11:32 (P); passing things through the fire Nu 31:23 (P); offering sin-offerings Le 12:7, Le 12:8, Le 14:20 (P); by the ceremony of the two birds Le 14:53 (P); by ashes of red heifer Nu 19:12, Nu 19:12 (P).

be clean morally, of people, made clean by ´[[י]]'s scattering clean water upon them Ez Eze 36:25; of Jerus., specif. made clean from idolatry, under fig. of adultery Je 13:27; also sq. [[מִן]] Ez Eze 24:13, Eze 24:13 (purification by ´[[י]]); made clean [[מִכָּל־חַטּאׁתֵיכֶם]] Le 16:30 (P; by the sin-offering of the atonement day); also of the individual, be clean [[מֵחַטָּאוֹת]] Pr 20:9 (‖[[זכה]]); become clean by use of hyssop Ps 51:9 (‖[[אַלְבִּין]]); more generally [[אִם־מֵעשֵׁׂהוּ יִטְהַר־גׇּ֑בֶר]] Job 4:17 shall a man be more pure than his maker? (‖[[יִחְדָָּק]]).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. [[טִהַר]] Le 13:3 + 4 t.; sf. [[טִהֲרוֹ]] Le 13:6 + 5 t.; 2 ms. [[טִהַרְתָּ]] Nu 8:6, Nu 8:15 etc. + 7 t. Pf.; Impf.; [[יְטַהֵר]] 2Ch 34:5 etc. + 4 t. Impf.; Imv. sf. [[טַהֲרֵנִי]] Ps 51:4; Inf. cstr. [[טַהֵר]] Ez Eze 39:12 + 5 t.; sf. [[טַהֲרִי]] Ez Eze 36:33 etc. + 4 t. Inf.; Pt. [[מְטַחֵר]] Le 14:11, Mal 3:3; —chiefly P;

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: physically, metals from dross Mal 3:3; land from corpses Ez Eze 39:12, Eze 39:14, Eze 39:16; heavens from clouds Job 37:21; temple from unclean things 2Ch 29:15, 2Ch 29:16, 2Ch 29:18; land and city from Asherim and images 2Ch 34:3, 2Ch 34:5, 2Ch 34:8; store-chambers of temple from household stuff Ne 13:9; priesthood by exclusion of alien blood Ne 13:30.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: ceremonially, the altar of incense by the blood of the annual sin-offering Le 16:19 (P); the people, gates, and wall (by some undefined ceremony) Ne 12:30; the altar of the court by the blood of sin-offerings Ez Eze 43:26; of consecration of Levites by [[מֵי חטאת]] Nu 8:6, Nu 8:7 (P), and [[חטאת]] Nu 8:15, Nu 8:21 (P).
pronounce clean, ceremonially Le 13:6, Le 13:13, Le 13:17, Le 13:23, Le 12:28, Le 13:34, Le 13:37, Le 13:59, Le 14:7, Le 14:48 (all P).
perform the ceremony of cleansing Le 14:11 (P).

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. [[טׂהַר]] 1Sa 20:26 (so. rd. for MT [[טהור]] LXX We Dr, he is not clean, because he hath not been cleansed); Pt. [[אֶרֶץ לאׁ]] [[מְטׂהָרָה]] a land not cleansed Ez Eze 22:24 (but LXX Hi Ew Co SS rd. a land not rained upon, v. [[מטר]]).

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: ceremonially, esp. in preparation for sacred duties Ge 35:2 (R), Nu 8:7, 2Ch 30:18, Ezr 6:20, Ne 13:22; also for heathen mysteries Is 66:17; of purifying priests, people, and wall Ne 12:30 (cf.

present oneself for purification, only pt. [[הַטִּטַּהֵר]] the candidate for purification Le 14:4, Le 14:7, Le 14:8, Le 14:11, Le 14:14, Le 14:17, Le 14:18, Le 14:19, Le 14:25, Le 14:28, Le 14:29, Le 14:31 (P).
